result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

4:27 PM Defendant Alejandro Gustavo Garcia appeared by phone, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin. 
Bond was already addressed before Court commissioner. 
950/Marsy's Law complied with. Victim in court and makes a statement to the court, requesting contact with defendant. State objects to request regarding contact and monetary amount. Court lowers bond to $2,500 cash bond and modifies bond condition to allow contact.
Court extend time limits and adjourns prelim to allow public defenders office add'l time to try and find counsel for defendant. Clerk to send petition for court appt. counsel to Defendant.

4:13 PM Defendant Alejandro Gustavo Garcia appeared by phone, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin. 
Public defenders office is still looking for counsel for defendant.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements; GPS monitoring-3 block radius of victims address. 
Defendant may have contact w/ victim 1 through telephone while the deft. is in custody.

2:31 PM Defendant Alejandro Gustavo Garcia appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mitchell Reagan LaCombe appeared by video for Alejandro Gustavo Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court Commissioner is covering this Bail/Bond Hearing for Br.4. Deft. does not have an attorney as of now. Atty. LaCombe is willing to proceed on representing the deft. only for the Bail/Bond Hearing today. 
State objects to the motion filed by the victim and does not believe contact to be appropriate, especially with an infant child involved. Court notes bond was set by him in B-10 - that the victims behavior was inappropriate at the initial appearance. Court will consider telephone contact between victim 1 and deft. while in custody only. State would agree to courts recommendation for contact by telephone while the deft. is in custody. Defense agrees to bond motion. Court will allow telephone contact with victim 1 while deft. is in custody. 
Defense asks to reduce bail amount-Court will not entertain because it was not in the motion nor was a motion to reduce bail filed. Court notes deft. will appear later this afternoon in Br. 4 and can ask for a reduction there if appropriate.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
